gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: USS Tecumseh
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Battle of Mobile Bay. 'Damn the torpedoes!' Admiral Farragut. National Register.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: SS Grandcamp
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Texas City Disaster. Deadliest industrial accident in US history. Destroyed.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: El Cazador
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Discovered 1993 by fishing trawler. Loss led to Louisiana Purchase.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: Deepwater Horizon
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Largest marine oil spill in history. BP disaster. Environmental catastrophe.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: SS Sultana
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: WORST maritime disaster in US history! More than Titanic. Mississippi River near Memphis.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: USS Hatteras
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Only Union warship sunk by Alabama in ship-to-ship combat. Off Galveston.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: U-166
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Only confirmed U-boat sunk in Gulf of Mexico. Found 2001 near Robert E Lee wreck.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: SS Robert E. Lee
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Sunk same day U-166 was destroyed. Both wrecks found together in 2001.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: Mardi Gras Wreck
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Oldest deepwater wreck in Gulf. Discovered 2002 by oil company. Pre-1800.

gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.name: SS Gulfpenn
gulf_of_mexico_wrecks.notes: Deepest shipwreck explored in Gulf. Found 2011 at 9,000ft by NOAA.
